page.title: 09Mobile Services, Whittlebury
page.content: Because of its situation there is a need in the area for a number of different mobile services supplying a variety of goods not otherwise easily obtainable. Public transport is sparse and expensive and small shops carry only limited stock. Milk is delivered 6 days a week and the dairy also offers fruit juice, eggs, potatoes and bread. A bread round on 3 days a week also supplies biscuits, pies and crisps. Three butchers and a fishmonger call weekly as do a mobile library and a caravan selling wool, knitting-patterns and needles. Twice weekly a fish and chip van calls. Hairdressing can be arranged at your home. A grocery bus and a grocery van come weekly. Beer and soft drinks can be left on your doorstep.
